intro: Hemitelia macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited hemitelia, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and the plant is often found in moist, shaded environments. Hemitelia macrocarpa is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
